DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code to signify the intensity scale for any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Therapeutic Procedure Intensity Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/1/10 released DEC per direction of model owner as part of caDSR model cleanup activity.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not severe or strong; far from extreme; not serious enough to endanger life.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
